isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Cylinder Heads

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields whenever using compressed air for cleaning purposes. Limit the air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi). See "Safety Information."

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, be sure cylinder head is free of debris, or a good seal between the cylinder head and gasket will not be possible, leading to oil, coolant and compression leakage. Do not apply sealant to head gasket surfaces.

To prevent engine damage, threads in crankcase bolt holes must be clean and blown dry with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil left in holes may cause binding or a false torque reading or both during assembly.

step1.para: If not performed already, clean all cylinder head bolt holes with a Head Bolt Bottoming Tap and remove debris with filtered compressed air. See Special Service Tools.

figure.caption: Installing the cylinder head spring dowel pins (2)

step1.para: Make sure two cylinder head spring dowel pins are installed (one at front and one at rear of crankcase).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, install a new cylinder head gasket with part number facing up. Verify top four bolt holes and cylinder head gasket push rod holes are all aligned.

note.para: Use care to avoid scratching blue compound on cylinder head gaskets.

step1.para: Place new cylinder head gasket over spring dowel pins and onto crankcase.

note.para: Cam followers cannot be removed or replaced when cylinder head is bolted to the crankcase. Be sure to complete any required work to cam followers before installing cylinder head.

step1.para: Install Cylinder Head Lifting Bracket in center of cylinder head (if removed). Tighten bracket mounting bolts. See Special Service Tools.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop cylinder head on gasket or slide it across gasket. Either action will damage cylinder head gasket and spring dowel pins, resulting in leakage.

figure.caption: Installing the cylinder head onto crankcase

step1.para: Attach hoist hook or lifting sling to lifting bracket. Raise cylinder head and align with guide pins, previously installed in crankcase.
Lower cylinder head onto head gasket.
Install two outer bolts (M8 x 70) across top of cylinder head. Run threads down until finger tight.
Install two inner bolts (M8 x 70) across the top of the cylinder head. Run threads down until finger tight.
Remove hoist and cylinder head lifting bracket.
